# The Math Forge: Calculations for Games

Games are full of math! Damage calculations, movement speed, timers - let's master them!

## Basic Math Operators

```gdscript
var a = 10
var b = 3

print(a + b)   # 13 (addition)
print(a - b)   # 7  (subtraction)
print(a * b)   # 30 (multiplication)
print(a / b)   # 3.333 (division)
print(a % b)   # 1  (modulo - remainder)
print(a ** b)  # 1000 (exponent - power)
```

## Integer Division

```gdscript
print(10 / 3)   # 3.333 (regular division)
print(10 // 3)  # 3 (integer division - no decimal)
```

## Math Functions

GDScript has built-in math functions:

```gdscript
print(abs(-5))      # 5 (absolute value)
print(max(10, 20))  # 20 (maximum)
print(min(10, 20))  # 10 (minimum)
print(pow(2, 3))    # 8 (2 to power of 3)
print(sqrt(16))     # 4 (square root)
```

## Rounding

```gdscript
print(round(3.7))   # 4
print(floor(3.7))   # 3 (round down)
print(ceil(3.2))    # 4 (round up)
```

## Your Quest

Create a damage calculator:

1. Calculate base damage from strength
2. Add weapon bonus
3. Apply critical hit multiplier
4. Calculate final damage with armor reduction
5. Round to nearest integer

solutionCode:
# Character stats
var strength = 15
var weapon_damage = 25
var critical_multiplier = 1.5
var enemy_armor = 10

# Calculate base damage (strength + weapon_damage)
var base_damage = strength + weapon_damage
print("Base damage: ", base_damage)

# Apply critical hit (multiply by critical_multiplier)
var critical_damage = base_damage * critical_multiplier
print("Critical damage: ", critical_damage)

# Reduce by armor (subtract enemy_armor)
var final_damage = critical_damage - enemy_armor
print("After armor: ", final_damage)

# Round to integer
var rounded_damage = round(final_damage)
print("Final damage: ", rounded_damage)
hints: Add strength and weapon_damage for base
Multiply by critical_multiplier for critical hit
Use round() function to get integer
Print each step to see the calculation
